snippet: The film, “India’s Daughter,” features an interview with Mukesh Singh, now on death row for the crime.
abstract: Indian authorities have moved to ban broadcast of British documentary film India's Daughter, about 2012 gang rape incident in Delhi; film, which features controversial interview with rapist Mukesh Singh, who is on death row for incident, has drawn mixed reactions throughout India.

byline.contributor: Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura contributed reporting from London, and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: The film, “India’s Daughter,” features an interview with Mukesh Singh, now on death row for the crime.

headline.main: Broadcast of India Gang Rape Documentary Is Banned by Court
headline.print_headline: Court Prohibits TV Broadcast in India of Documentary Film About Gang Rape
